org.eclipse.graphiti.func
Interface IRemove

All Known Subinterfaces:
IPattern, IRemoveFeature
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPattern, DefaultRemoveFeature, IdPattern, RemoveFeatureForPattern, TypedPattern
public interface IRemove

Instances of this interface provide the behavior to remove objects. Removing means removing the graphical representation of a business object from the diagram while keeping the business object itself as it is.

Since:
0.8.0

Method Summary

Method Detail

canRemove

boolean canRemove(IRemoveContext context)
Checks if given object could be removed.

Parameters:
context - contains object to remove
Returns:
true if remove is possible

preRemove

void preRemove(IRemoveContext context)
called prior to remove call.

Parameters:
context - the context

isRemoveAbort

boolean isRemoveAbort()
The Graphiti framework will call this method after preRemove(IRemoveContext) has been called and before the actual remove is done. In case this method returns true, the operation will be cancelled by the Graphiti framework by throwing an OperationCanceledException that causes am EMF revert of the operation.

Implementing classes might e.g. set a flag in preRemove(IRemoveContext) as cancellation indication and check that that flag here.

Returns:
true in case you want to cancel the current operation, false otherwise.
Since:
0.12
